title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.107 - Executive Order No. 107: Declaring an emergency in New York State and directing the Office of General Services to provide equipment and assistance to aid in the establishment of temporary shelters in New York State armories
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.107 - Executive Order No. 107: Declaring an emergency in New York State and directing the Office of General Services to provide equipment and assistance to aid in the establishment of temporary shelters in New York State armories

State Regulations
WHEREAS, Extremely cold weather conditions have endangered
the health and welfare of thousands of individuals in New York State who live
in residences without adequate heat, and that local social services departments
require the assistance of the Office of General Services to utilize New York

State armories as temporary shelters for such individuals; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Hugh L. Carey, by virture of the
authority vested in me as Governor under section 28 of article 2B of the New

York State Executive Law, do hereby declare an emergency in New York State. Further, pursuant to section 29 of article 2B of the New York State Executive

Law, I direct the Office of General Services to take such action as necessary
to assist local social services departments to utilize New York State armories
as temporary shelters. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 5, 1981
